p: Although all age groups are susceptible to the virus, the incidence of COVID-19 in children (1.3%) is three times lesser than that in adults (3.5%). 3 Also, with the exception of those with cardiovascular and other comorbidities, children are generally less prone to severe COVID-19 and related mortality, 5 6 which could be due to the peculiarities of their adaptive immune system and low prevalence of cytokine storm syndromes. 7 Rare cases of COVID-19 in children at the early stage of the pandemic are likely associated with lower exposure to the virus which increased with exponential growth of the number of infected individuals. 8
